name: longship
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a long and narrow ship with one square sail (= sheet of material attached to a pole to catch the wind and make the ship move) and many oars (= long poles with a wide, flat part at one end, used for moving a boat), used by the Viking people: It was too small for a Viking longship, but not sufficiently decorated to be the ship of a king. Vikings set out on longships from Scandinavia, and ended up in places like Scotland and Ireland.
More examplesFewer examplesTheViking longship was the design classic of its age.He looks like a modern Viking and could probably row a longship on his own.At the exhibition, you can see a full-size longship, costumes, shields, and photographs.
